intro: Ligusticum sinense var. alpinum, commonly known as alpine Chinese lovage, is a perennial herb native to high-altitude regions of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine soils, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a strong, pungent odor, while its small white flowers appear in clusters. This variant is notable for its ecological adaptations to harsh mountain climates.
